Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of East Greek black-figure pottery kylix with trace of stem; white slip on exterior; interior painted (fired brown) save disc on floor; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of male figure to right (head, torso, and one arm missing; wearing himation with traces of dots in added white); at left, part of incised lotus flower.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Price 1924 suggests a Klazomenian origin, which seems unlikely
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1033)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (35, pl. 17, 69)
